intro: Malperia tenuis, commonly known as the slender malperia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Malperia tenuis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
